description:
The **AWSSupport-ResetLinuxUserPassword** runbook allows you to set or reset the password of a local user. The user and password can be used for serial console access to troubleshoot boot, network configuration, and other issues. For more information please review [Configure access to the EC2 Serial Console](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/configure-access-to-serial-console.html). The runbook creates a temporary Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance in your account and an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that is attached to the temporary EC2 instance with permissions to retrieve the Secrets Manager secret value containing the password. The runbook stops the target EC2 instance, detaches the root volume, and attach it to the temporary instance where a script is executed using Systems Manager Run Command. Then the volume is attached back to your instance. The runbook requires you to provide an AWS Secrets Manager secret containing the password. In case of failure, the runbook creates a new volume from the snapshot and attach it to the target EC2 Instance if you have selected the option to create a snapshot.

## AWS Secrets Manager setup

The script retrieves the password with a runtime call to Secrets Manager. Follow these steps to create a new AWS Secrets Manager secret:

1. Open the Secrets Manager console at https://console.aws.amazon.com/secretsmanager/
1. Choose **Store a new secret**.
1. On the **Choose secret type** page, choose **Other type of secret**
1. In Key/value pairs choose the **Plaintext** tab and enter the password (Please see the password requirements noted below).
1. For **Encryption key**, choose **aws/secretsmanager** to use the AWS managed key for Secrets Manager.
1. On the **Configure secret** page, enter a descriptive **Secret name** and **Description**. Click **Next**
1. On the **Configure rotation** page, you can choose to turn on automatic rotation. You can also keep rotation off for now and then turn it on later. Click **Next**
1. On the **Review** page, review your secret details, and then choose **Store**.
1. Take note of the **Secret ARN**. You will use this value in the ```SecretId``` runbook parameter.

For more details refer to [Create an AWS Secrets Manager secret](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/secretsmanager/latest/userguide/create_secret.html)


### Important
>
> * Changing the local user password requires the runbook to **stop** your instance. When the instance is stopped, any data stored in the RAM or the instance store volumes is lost, and the automatic public IPv4 address is released. For more information please review [Stop and start your instance](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/Stop_Start.html#instance_stop).
> * It is a good practice to make regular backups of your persistent disk data. Consider taking a snapshot of your EBS volumes before running this runbook or leave the ```CreateSnapshot``` parameter as ```Yes```.
> * If your EC2 instance EBS volumes are encrypted with a customer managed Key Management Service (KMS) key, make sure the KMS key is not **deleted** or **disabled** or your instance will fail to start.

InstanceId.description: (Required) The EC2 instance ID of the target instance on which the Linux user password should be set or reset.

SecretArn.description: (Required) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of your Secrets Manager secret containing the key value pair. The AWS CloudFormation stack creates a temporary instance with permissions to perform the GetSecretValue operation to this ARN. Make sure that the password is stored as plaintext.

LinuxUserName.description: (Optional) The username for which you want to reset the password. Defaults to 'ec2-user'. Please refer to [Manage user accounts on your Linux instance](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/managing-users.html) to see a list of the default user names for Linux Amazon Machine Images (AMIs) provided by AWS.

AutomationAssumeRole.description: (Optional) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that allows Systems Manager Automation to perform the actions on your behalf. If no role is specified, Systems Manager Automation uses the permissions of the user that starts this runbook.

SecurityGroupId.description: (Optional) The security group ID that will be associated to the temporary EC2 instance. If not provided, the default VPC security group is used.

SubnetId.description: (Optional) The subnet ID for the EC2 helper instance. By default, the same subnet where the provided instance resides is used. IMPORTANT: If you provide a custom subnet, it must be in the same Availability Zone as InstanceId. The helper instance subnet must allow access to the Systems Manager endpoints via virtual private cloud (VPC) endpoints or Internet.

CreateSnapshot.description: (Required) Select "Yes" or "No" to create a snapshot of the target instance root EBS volume before running this automation.

StopConsent.description: (Required) Select "Yes" if you acknowledge that this runbook will stop and start your EC2 instance if it was running in order to detach its root EBS volume. When the instance is stopped, any data stored in the RAM or the instance store volumes is lost, and the automatic public IPv4 address is released. For more information please review [Stop and start your instance](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/Stop_Start.html#instance_stop).

mainSteps.name: CheckStopConsent
mainSteps.description: Evaluates explicit consent for stopping the Amazon EC2 Instance.

mainSteps.name: AssertInitialState
mainSteps.description: Ensures the EC2 instance status is in "running" or "stopped" state; otherwise the automation ends.

mainSteps.name: GetInstanceProperties
mainSteps.description: Gets the EC2 instance properties.

mainSteps.name: GetInstanceRootVolume
mainSteps.description: Gets the EC2 instance root volume properties.

mainSteps.name: BranchOnSubnetId
mainSteps.description: Branches the automation depending on whether an custom subnet ID for the target EC2 instance was provided or not.

mainSteps.name: AssertCustomSubnetIsInSameAZAsInstance
mainSteps.description: Ensures the custom subnet is in the same availability zone as the target EC2 instance.

mainSteps.name: AssertInstanceRootVolumeIsEbs
mainSteps.description: Ensures the EC2 instance root volume is EBS.

mainSteps.name: AssertInstanceArchitecture
mainSteps.description: Ensures the EC2 instance architecture is "arm64" or "x86_64".

mainSteps.name: AssertInstanceStopBehaviorIsStop
mainSteps.description: Ensures the EC2 instance shutdown behavior is "stop" and not "terminate".

mainSteps.name: AssertInstanceLifecycleIsNotSpot
mainSteps.description: Ensures the EC2 instance Lifecycle is not "Spot"; otherwise the automation ends.

mainSteps.name: AssertNotPartOfAutoScalingGroup
mainSteps.description: Ensures the EC2 instance is not part of an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group by calling the "DescribeAutoScalingInstances" API. If the instance is part of an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group, ensures the EC2 instance is in 'Standby' lifecycle state.

import sys
import boto3
from botocore.exceptions import ClientError

sys.tracebacklimit = 0
autoscaling = boto3.client('autoscaling')

def check_autoscaling_resource(events,context):
    
    try:
        instances = autoscaling.describe_auto_scaling_instances(
            InstanceIds = [ events['InstanceId'] ]
        )['AutoScalingInstances']
        if instances and instances[0]['LifecycleState'] not in ['Standby']:
            raise Exception('The target EC2 instance is part of an EC2 Auto Scaling Group and not in "Standby" lifecycle state')
        else:
            return

    except ClientError as e:
        c = e.response['Error']['Code']
        m = e.response['Error']['Message']
        raise Exception(f'An error occurred when describing Auto Scaling instances: {c}:{m}')

mainSteps.name: CreateEc2HelperInstance
mainSteps.description: Creates a temporary EC2 instance to be used for resetting the user password using AWS CloudFormation.

inputs.TemplateBody:
AWSTemplateFormatVersion: 2010-09-09
Description: Deploy Single EC2 Linux Instance with IAM Instance profile
Parameters:
  CustomSecurityGroupId:
    Type: String
    Default: ''
  CustomSubnetId:
    Type: String
    Default: ''
  InstanceSubnetId:
    Type: String
    Default: ''
  Architecture:
    Type: String
    AllowedValues:
      - arm64
      - x86_64
  SecretArn:
    Type: String
  AmiId:
    Type: 'AWS::SSM::Parameter::Value<AWS::EC2::Image::Id>'
    Default: /aws/service/ami-amazon-linux-latest/amzn2-ami-hvm-x86_64-gp2
  AmiIdARM:
    Type: 'AWS::SSM::Parameter::Value<AWS::EC2::Image::Id>'
    Default: /aws/service/ami-amazon-linux-latest/amzn2-ami-hvm-arm64-gp2
Conditions:
  IsArchitectureARM: !Equals 
    - !Ref Architecture
    - arm64
  UseCustomSecurityGroup: !Not 
    - !Equals 
      - !Ref CustomSecurityGroupId
      - ''
  UseCustomSubnet: !Not 
    - !Equals 
      - !Ref CustomSubnetId
      - ''
Resources:
  HelperIamInstanceProfileRole:
    Type: 'AWS::IAM::Role'
    Properties:
      AssumeRolePolicyDocument:
        Version: 2012-10-17
        Statement:
          - Effect: Allow
            Principal:
              Service:
                - ec2.amazonaws.com
            Action:
              - 'sts:AssumeRole'
      ManagedPolicyArns:
        - !Sub 'arn:${AWS::Partition}:iam::aws:policy/AmazonSSMManagedInstanceCore'
        - !Sub 'arn:${AWS::Partition}:iam::aws:policy/AmazonSSMPatchAssociation'
      Policies:
        - PolicyName: AllowSecretsManagerAccess
          PolicyDocument:
            Version: 2012-10-17
            Statement:
              - Effect: Allow
                Action:
                  - 'secretsmanager:GetSecretValue'
                Resource: !Ref SecretArn
              - Effect: Allow
                Action:
                  - 'logs:CreateLogGroup'
                  - 'logs:CreateLogStream'
                  - 'logs:DescribeLogStreams'
                  - 'logs:PutLogEvents'
                Resource: '*'
  HelperIamInstanceProfile:
    Type: 'AWS::IAM::InstanceProfile'
    Properties:
      Roles:
        - !Ref HelperIamInstanceProfileRole
  HelperEc2InstanceLaunchTemplate:
    Type: AWS::EC2::LaunchTemplate
    Properties:
      LaunchTemplateData:
        MetadataOptions:
          HttpEndpoint: enabled
          HttpTokens: required
          HttpPutResponseHopLimit: 1
  HelperEc2Instance:
    Type: 'AWS::EC2::Instance'
    Properties:
      IamInstanceProfile: !Ref HelperIamInstanceProfile
      ImageId: !If 
        - IsArchitectureARM
        - !Ref AmiIdARM
        - !Ref AmiId
      LaunchTemplate:
        LaunchTemplateId: !Ref HelperEc2InstanceLaunchTemplate
        Version: !GetAtt HelperEc2InstanceLaunchTemplate.LatestVersionNumber
      InstanceType: !If 
        - IsArchitectureARM
        - t4g.small
        - t3.small
      PropagateTagsToVolumeOnCreation: true
      BlockDeviceMappings:
        - DeviceName: /dev/xvda
          Ebs:
            VolumeSize: 8
            Encrypted: true
            VolumeType: gp3
            DeleteOnTermination: true
      NetworkInterfaces:
        - DeleteOnTermination: true
          AssociatePublicIpAddress: true
          DeviceIndex: '0'
          GroupSet:
            - !If 
              - UseCustomSecurityGroup
              - !Ref CustomSecurityGroupId
              - Ref: AWS::NoValue
          SubnetId: !If 
            - UseCustomSubnet
            - !Ref CustomSubnetId
            - !Ref InstanceSubnetId
Outputs:
  HelperInstanceId:
    Description: The Instance ID
    Value: !Ref HelperEc2Instance

mainSteps.name: WaitForEc2HelperInstanceCreation
mainSteps.description: Waits until the Amazon EC2 instance created by the AWS CloudFormation is running.

mainSteps.name: FindEc2HelperInstanceId
mainSteps.description: Gets the ID for the EC2 helper instance created by AWS CloudFormation.

mainSteps.name: WaitForHelperInstanceToBeSsmManaged
mainSteps.description: Waits for the temporary EC2 helper instance to become managed by Systems Manager.

mainSteps.name: StopInstance
mainSteps.description: Stops the EC2 instance.

mainSteps.name: ForceStopInstance
mainSteps.description: Forces the EC2 instance to stop in case it gets stuck in stopping state.

mainSteps.name: BranchIfCreateSnapshot
mainSteps.description: Branches the automation depending on whether an snapshot of the target EC2 instance EBS root volume was requested or not.

mainSteps.name: CreateSnapshot
mainSteps.description: Creates an snapshot of the target EC2 instance root EBS volume.

mainSteps.name: WaitForSnapshotCompleted
mainSteps.description: Waits for the snapshot to be in "completed" state.

mainSteps.name: DetachRootEbsVolumeFromInstance
mainSteps.description: Detaches the EBS root volume from the target EC2 instance.

mainSteps.name: WaitForInstanceRootVolumeToBeDetached
mainSteps.description: Waits for the EBS root volume to be detached from the target EC2 instance.

mainSteps.name: AttachRootEbsVolumeToHelperInstance
mainSteps.description: Attaches the root EBS volume to the helper EC2 instance.

mainSteps.name: WaitForInstanceRootVolumeToBeAttachedToHelperInstance
mainSteps.description: Waits for the EBS root volume to be attached to the helper EC2 instance.

mainSteps.name: SetPasswordForLinuxUser
mainSteps.description: Resets the target user password by running a shell script using Systems Manager Run Command on the helper EC2 instance.

readonly fetchpass=$(aws secretsmanager get-secret-value --secret-id $secpwd --region $REGION --output text --query SecretString)
partition=$(fdisk -l $disk | awk "/Device/,EOF" | grep "/dev/xvd.*Linux" | grep -v  boot | cut -d " " -f 1)
partition=$(fdisk -l $disk | awk "/Device/,EOF" | grep "/dev/nvme.*Linux" | grep -v  boot | cut -d " " -f 1)
[[ -z $partition ]] && throw "An error occurred when trying to find the partition for disk $disk"
mount -o nouuid $partition $mountDir >/dev/null 2>&1 || throw "An error occurred when trying to mount the attached volume $volumeId"
echo "Attached volume $volumeId with partition $partition mounted successfully."
echo $userName:$fetchpass | chroot $mountDir chpasswd 2>/dev/null || throw "An error occurred when trying to set the password for $userName"
umount $mountDir 2>/dev/null || throw "An error occurred when trying to unmount the attached volume"

mainSteps.name: DetachEbsRootVolumeFromHelperInstance
mainSteps.description: Detaches the EBS root volume from the helper EC2 instance.

mainSteps.name: WaitForInstanceRootVolumeToBeDetachedFromHelperInstance
mainSteps.description: Waits for the EBS root volume to be detached to the helper EC2 instance.

mainSteps.name: DetachEbsRootVolumeFromHelperInstanceAfterError
mainSteps.description: Detaches the EBS root volume from the helper EC2 instance after an error.

mainSteps.name: WaitForInstanceRootVolumeToBeDetachedFromHelperInstanceAfterError
mainSteps.description: Waits for the EBS root volume to be detached from the helper EC2 instance after an error.

mainSteps.name: RestoreRootVolumeIfSnapshot
mainSteps.description: Branches the automation depending on whether a snapshot of the root volume was requested to determine the recovery path in case of failure.

mainSteps.name: AttachRootEbsVolumeBackToInstance
mainSteps.description: Attaches the root EBS volume back to target EC2 instance.

mainSteps.name: WaitForAttachRootEbsVolumeBackToInstance
mainSteps.description: Waits for the EBS root volume to be attached to the EC2 instance.

mainSteps.name: CreateNewRootVolumeFromSnapshot
mainSteps.description: Creates a new EBS volume from the target EC2 instance root volume snapshot.

mainSteps.name: WaitForVolumeAvailable
mainSteps.description: Waits until the new EBS volume is in "available" state

mainSteps.name: AttachNewRootVolumeFromSnapshot
mainSteps.description: Attaches the new EBS volume to the target instance as root volume.

mainSteps.name: VerifyNewRootVolumeAttached
mainSteps.description: Waits for the EBS volume to be in "attached" state.

mainSteps.name: DescribeCloudFormationErrorFromStackEvents
mainSteps.description: Describes the AWS CloudFormation stack events if the runbooks fails to create or update the AWS CloudFormation stack.

mainSteps.name: BranchOnPreviousInstanceState
mainSteps.description: Branches the automation depending on the previous EC2 instance state; if it was "running", starts it again; if it was in "stopped" state, the automation continues.

mainSteps.name: StartInstance
mainSteps.description: Starts the EC2 instance.

mainSteps.name: WaitCloudFormationStackRollback
mainSteps.description: Waits until the AWS CloudFormation stack is in a terminal status before deleting.

mainSteps.name: DeleteCloudFormationStack
mainSteps.description: Deletes the AWS CloudFormation stack including the temporary EC2 helper instance.
